messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the reminder I created yesterday?
Sure—so that I search the correct time range, could you tell me which time zone you’re in (or roughly where you are) so I can figure out exactly what counts as “yesterday”?
I don't have that info right now.

No problem. We just need some way to pin down what counts as “yesterday.”  

Would you be able to tell me roughly where you are (city or country) or your current UTC-offset (for example, UTC-5, UTC+2, etc.)? Even an estimate is fine—then I can search the right 24-hour window.
Sorry, I don't have that info either.

That’s totally fine—we can still find your reminder; we just have to agree on what time window to look at.

Would it work for me to treat “yesterday” as “the 24-hour period that ended right now” (i.e., anything created between 24 hours ago and the present)? If that sounds okay, just let me know and I’ll go ahead and search that range.

To narrow it down to reminders created in the last 24 hours, I need to know what “now” is for you. Could you tell me the current date and time as it shows on your device (even just the approximate month-day-year and hour:minute)? Once I have that, I can search everything created between “now minus 24 hours” and “now.”
I don't have access to that info either.

Understood. To make the search concrete, could I treat “yesterday” as “the entire calendar day that most recently ended at 00:00 UTC today” (i.e., midnight-to-midnight in the UTC time zone)?  

If that works for you, just let me know and I’ll use that window to look up any reminders created during that period.

messages.name: search_reminder
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('reminder_id', 'content', 'creation_timestamp', 'creation_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'latitude', 'longitude')

To zero-in on “yesterday” I still need at least one concrete piece of date information—otherwise I can’t create the time window the system requires for searching.

Could you tell me today’s date as you see it (for example, “March 12 2025”)?  
No time or time-zone details needed—just the calendar date is enough.
I really don’t have any date or time info right now.

No worries—we can still find it, but the search tool needs at least one concrete clue to look up a reminder.  

Could you give me any detail you remember about the reminder—for example:

• a word or short phrase that’s in the reminder text  
• something about the location it’s tied to  
• roughly what you asked to be reminded about  

Even a single keyword is enough for me to run the search and then pick out the one created during “yesterday” in UTC.
